documents.content: Claim submitted for narrowband UVB phototherapy sessions at Dermatology Specialists of Central Texas. Policy #SKIN-5570 covers 12 sessions annually for documented photosensitivity disorders. Patient is 34-year-old outdoor worker with provider-diagnosed polymorphous light eruption. Initial claim processing shows $150 copay per session under new 2024 benefit guidelines.

Clinical notes from 03/15/2024 visit: Patient presents with recurrent rash consistent with polymorphous light eruption. Recommended course includes 12-week narrowband UVB protocol. Practice alert: New coverage requirements under Policy #SKIN-5570 require pre-authorization and severity grading scales for phototherapy approval.

Internal memo RE: Policy #SKIN-5570 implementation. Effective March 2024, Austin-area providers must use standardized assessment tools for phototherapy approvals. Dermatology Specialists of Central Texas identified as regional center of excellence. New documentation requirements reduce claim denials by 18% in first quarter.

Updated coverage guidelines for Policy #SKIN-5570 now include narrowband UVB for five specific photodermatoses. Requirements: baseline severity score ≥6 on STANDARD-PLE scale, failure of topical treatments, and provider certification. Applies to commercial plans in Travis County through 2025.
